hook.text: Deduction is certain but limited. It can only tell you what's already contained in what you know.

buildup.text: Every valid deduction just unpacks information hidden in the premises. It adds zero new knowledge.

discovery.text: To learn new things about the world, you need observation and induction â€” not just pure logic.

twist.text: A perfectly deductive thinker who never observes the world would know everything about nothing.

climax.text: Deduction gives certainty. Induction gives discovery. You need both to navigate reality.

punchline.text: Logic is powerful. But it can't tell you anything new.

quiz.question: What is deduction's main limitation?
options: It cannot generate new knowledge beyond what's in the premises
